page.title: 06Brackley Market Survey
page.content: We conducted a survey among Brackley stall holders and found out that most of them go to other markets also, such as Banbury, Oxford and Dunstable etc. Stall holders have on average been coming to Brackley for 4 years. It sells a wide variety of goods such as cheese, clothes, meat, double glazing, fish, china, sweets, fruit, pet food and vegetables. Stallholders buy their stocks from many different wholesalers from as far apart as London and Stoke-on-Trent. Some of the unsold stock is kept in garages and store rooms and some in large vans so that storage and transport are combined. Goods sold vary with the time of year. Fabric, clothes and fruit sell well in summer, and in winter sweets, tights and double glazing. Most stall holders found theft a problem, with something being stolen every week.
